messageBody:
Hi Gabriel,

On 2/9/07, Gabriel Nascimento <gamnascimento@...> wrote:
> My Domain Model already access objects that carry business rules parameters.
> I simulate them using EasyMock. It´s working fine.
>
> Unit Tests are used as example of use of my API and I should call only my
> public methods, cause that is what will be invoked by the client. But, I
> want to test each method, and each business rule separated.
>
> So, I don´t know if changing my private validation methods to protected,
> only for unit test using, is a bad practice...

How about doing something like this:

public class BusinessRuleTest extends TestCase {

private DomainObject obj;

protected void setUp() {
obj = new DomainObject();
obj.setFoo(12);
obj.setBar(13);
}

public void testValidState() {
assertTrue(obj.validate());
}

public void testFooShouldBePositive() {
obj.setFoo(-12);
assertFalse(obj.validate());
}

public void testFooShouldBeSmallerThanBar() {
obj.setFoo(14);
assertFalse(obj.validate());
}

// more business rule tests...
}


Lasse
